TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Accuracy extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values returned by several types.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy Coarse = int32(2)

summary.para: A constant indicating an approximate accuracy requirement

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy Fine = int32(1)

summary.para: A constant indicating a finer location accuracy requirement

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy High = int32(3)

summary.para: a constant indicating a high accuracy requirement - may be used for horizontal, altitude, speed or bearing accuracy. For horizontal and vertical position this corresponds roughly to an accuracy of less than 100 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy Low = int32(1)

summary.para: A constant indicating a low location accuracy requirement - may be used for horizontal, altitude, speed or bearing accuracy. For horizontal and vertical position this corresponds roughly to an accuracy of greater than 500 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy Medium = int32(2)

summary.para: A constant indicating a medium accuracy requirement - currently used only for horizontal accuracy. For horizontal position this corresponds roughly to to an accuracy of between 100 and 500 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.Accuracy NoRequirement = int32(0)
